messages: 22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:03): is preparing a teleconference

22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:04): 4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240, make logs public
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (20:04): I have made the request, 22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:04): 17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf, this will be DOM3
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (20:04): ok, 22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592, I see IA_WebApps(DOM3)2:00PM already started
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:04): Meeting: Web Applications Working Group Teleconference
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (20:04): ok, 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6; the call is being made
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (20:04): -[Microsoft]
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (20:04): +[Microsoft]
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (20:04): +Shepazu
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (20:04): +[IPcaller]
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (20:05): 17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf, [IPcaller] is Olli_Pettay
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (20:05): +Olli_Pettay; got it
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:07): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: New draft of the spec is now available.
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:07): DOM3 spec updated: http://dev.w3.org//2006/webapi/DOM-Level-3-Events/html/DOM3-Events.html
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:10): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: I will take the 'magnify' event out and introduce it to the AIDE spec (Alternate Input Device Events)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:10): http://dev.w3.org//2006/webapi/DOM-Level-3-Events/html/DOM3-Events.html#event-type-wheel
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:19): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Extended the ContextInfo section (per event--not done with it yet) to show the per-property value.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:21): bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350: If stopPropagation() is called on an event and then it is later dispatched, what should happen?
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:23): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Is there a resolution to add the Event interface's properties to the ContextInfo?
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:25): Topic: UIEvent/ Event interfaces (dual)

d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:28): Our implementation is making most of the Events (that were changed to be UIEvents) UIEvents. I figured it's better to provide the 'detail' and 'view' properties.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:30): bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350: DOM L2 Events speced most of these as deriving from Event interface. Some implementations are mapping the events as such.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:31): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Wondering what the implications are for having them be UIEvents?
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:31): ... kinda makes sense semantically.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:32): ... I'm not passionate about either way.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:34): ... For now, I will leave these as-is (and note the change from Event to UIEvent)
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:35): Topic: Keyboard events (Dead Keys)

d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:38): Windows platform does not natively offer dead key support to it's applications (via windows messages). Applications that want to support dead keys have to implment that support themselves.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:38): Action: 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 to note to authors that dead-key support may not be available in some operating systems.
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:38): noticed an ACTION. Trying to create it.
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (20:38): records action 1
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:38): Created ACTION-499 - Note to authors that dead-key support may not be available in some operating systems. [on Doug Schepers - due 2010-03-10].
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:39): Topic: Key Value issues
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:39): http://dev.w3.org/2006/webapi/DOM-Level-3-Events/html/DOM3-Events.html#key-values
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:40): BrowserBack, VolumeMute keys; what is the KeyboardEvent.location for them?
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:43): Action 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 to state that unless otherwise noted, all key locations should be DOM_KEY_LOCATION_STANDARD.
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:43): noticed an ACTION. Trying to create it.
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:43): Created ACTION-500 - State that unless otherwise noted, all key locations should be DOM_KEY_LOCATION_STANDARD. [on Doug Schepers - due 2010-03-10].
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:45): Topic: composition events and AltGraph key combos...
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:45): http://dev.w3.org/2006/webapi/DOM-Level-3-Events/html/DOM3-Events.html#keyset-DeadKeys
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:45): In the link, the two examples show composition events firing for dead keys, do they also fire for AltGraph combos?
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:46): ... Wanting a little more clarity...
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:51): ... In the Issue filed on first example, step 5: our prototype feedback is that the key value should be e-with-accent.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:52): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: I should make a note, that the keydown in this example could be a combination of keys...
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:53): bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350: I don't believe that Gecko fires composition events in these cases (dead key/alt graph)...
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:55): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: It's possible that composition events fire only when using an IME.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:58): Action: 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 to clarify that key named key values (from sectoin 6.2.7) are not to be localized.
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (20:58): records action 2
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:58): noticed an ACTION. Trying to create it.
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:58): Created ACTION-501 - Clarify that key named key values (from sectoin 6.2.7) are not to be localized. [on Doug Schepers - due 2010-03-10].
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:01): Action: 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 to add a Calculator key to the named key values list.
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (21:01): noticed an ACTION. Trying to create it.
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (21:01): records action 3
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (21:01): Created ACTION-502 - Add a Calculator key to the named key values list. [on Doug Schepers - due 2010-03-10].
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:05): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Back to the composition events topic for keyboard combos...
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:09): ... It might be useful to have composition events fire (even simulated) to allow web-page ime simulation.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:10): Action: d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 to discuss the process for getting a key value and any peripheral composition event simulation necessary.
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (21:10): noticed an ACTION. Trying to create it.
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (21:10): records action 4

22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (21:10): Created ACTION-503 - Discuss the process for getting a key value and any peripheral composition event simulation necessary. [on d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 Leithead - due 2010-03-10].

bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (21:11): From a bug comment: "And looks like the draft still has some issues, e.g., compositionstart event is cancelable, but on GTK2 with uim or iBus, we cannot discard/commit the composition forcedly... I think the cancelable should be an option. The spec shouldn't guarantee that it's cancelable."
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:13): Action: bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 to uncover for GTK whether compositionstart can be cancelable.
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (21:13): noticed an ACTION. Trying to create it.
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (21:13): records action 5
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (21:13): Created ACTION-504 - Uncover for GTK whether compositionstart can be cancelable. [on Olli Pettay - due 2010-03-10].
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (21:13): "Should the compositionupdate event be fired only when the data value is changed? For example, our text event is dispatched when the caret
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (21:13): position is changed in composition. But it seems that the event is redundant for web developers."
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:17): Topic: Key location mobile
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:18): What are examples of this?
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:18): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: soft keys may be mobile.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:18): ... the number keys (0-9) on a phone would be from location: mobile

d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:19): ... Example: web-based keyboard composition system--might be useful to know if it came from mobile, to map numbers (e.g., #2) to common letter combinations (ABC).
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:21): Action: 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 Cite examples of when keys might be from DOM_KEY_LOCATION_MOBILE.
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (21:21): noticed an ACTION. Trying to create it.
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (21:21): records action 6
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (21:21): Created ACTION-505 - Cite examples of when keys might be from DOM_KEY_LOCATION_MOBILE. [on Doug Schepers - due 2010-03-10].
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:23): Topic: Clarifying Key values
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:23): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Feedback on the list from Hallvord re: usage of the key property.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:24): bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350: Should show [more] examples of usage of KeyboardEvent.key
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:25): May also want to remove the quotes from the unicode strings. E.g., '\u0009' should just be \u0009
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:25): Topic: Next Telecon
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:26): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: I've got a lot going on, and won't have time to host a telecon for the next two weeks.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:27): ... Please send feedback to the list as they come. The spec probably won't change much.
